com.netflix.spectator.sandbox

Class BucketFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.sandbox.BucketFunctions
  • Deprecated. 
    Moved to com.netflix.spectator.api.histogram package. This is now just a thin wrapper to preserve compatibility. Scheduled for removal after in Q3 2016.

    public final class BucketFunctions
extends Object
    Helpers for creating bucketing functions.

    • Method Detail

      • age

        public static BucketFunction age(long max,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a function that maps age values to a set of buckets. Example use-case would be tracking the age of data flowing through a processing pipeline. Values that are less than 0 will be marked as "future". These typically occur due to minor variations in the clocks across nodes. In addition to a bucket at the max, it will create buckets at max / 2, max / 4, and max / 8.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum expected age of data flowing through. Values greater than this max will be mapped to an "old" bucket.
        unit - Unit for the max value.
        Returns:
        Function mapping age values to string labels. The labels for buckets will sort so they can be used with a simple group by.

      • latency

        public static BucketFunction latency(long max,
                                     TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a function that maps latencies to a set of buckets. Example use-case would be tracking the amount of time to process a request on a server. Values that are less than 0 will be marked as "negative_latency". These typically occur due to minor variations in the clocks, e.g., using System.currentTimeMillis() to measure the latency and having a time adjustment between the start and end. In addition to a bucket at the max, it will create buckets at max / 2, max / 4, and max / 8.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum expected age of data flowing through. Values greater than this max will be mapped to an "old" bucket.
        unit - Unit for the max value.
        Returns:
        Function mapping age values to string labels. The labels for buckets will sort so they can be used with a simple group by.

      • ageBiasOld

        public static BucketFunction ageBiasOld(long max,
                                        TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a function that maps age values to a set of buckets. Example use-case would be tracking the age of data flowing through a processing pipeline. Values that are less than 0 will be marked as "future". These typically occur due to minor variations in the clocks across nodes. In addition to a bucket at the max, it will create buckets at max - max / 8, max - max / 4, and max - max / 2.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum expected age of data flowing through. Values greater than this max will be mapped to an "old" bucket.
        unit - Unit for the max value.
        Returns:
        Function mapping age values to string labels. The labels for buckets will sort so they can be used with a simple group by.

      • latencyBiasSlow

        public static BucketFunction latencyBiasSlow(long max,
                                             TimeUnit unit)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a function that maps latencies to a set of buckets. Example use-case would be tracking the amount of time to process a request on a server. Values that are less than 0 will be marked as "negative_latency". These typically occur due to minor variations in the clocks, e.g., using System.currentTimeMillis() to measure the latency and having a time adjustment between the start and end. In addition to a bucket at the max, it will create buckets at max - max / 8, max - max / 4, and max - max / 2.
        Parameters:
        max - Maximum expected age of data flowing through. Values greater than this max will be mapped to an "old" bucket.
        unit - Unit for the max value.
        Returns:
        Function mapping age values to string labels. The labels for buckets will sort so they can be used with a simple group by.
